titleStmt.title: The novelty every act a play : being a short pastoral, comedy, masque, tragedy, and farce, after the Italian manner : as it is acted at the new-theatre in Little Lincolns Inn-Fields, by His Majesties servants / written by Mr. Motteux and other hands.
titleStmt.author: Motteux, Peter Anthony, 1660-1718.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A51504 of text R36606 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing M2958). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 202 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 33 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The novelty every act a play : being a short pastoral, comedy, masque, tragedy, and farce, after the Italian manner : as it is acted at the new-theatre in Little Lincolns Inn-Fields, by His Majesties servants / written by Mr. Motteux and other hands.
titleStmt.author: Motteux, Peter Anthony, 1660-1718.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Rich. Parker ... and Peter Buck ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
Thyrsis, a pastoral -- All without money, a short comedy -- Hercules, a masque -- The unfortunate couple, a short tragedy -- Natural magic, a short farce after the Italian manner.

ep:epHeader.ep:title: The Novelty: Every Act a Play: Consists of Thyrsis (Pastoral), by Oldmixon; All without Money (Comedy), by Motteux; Hercules ('Mask'), by Motteux; The Unfortunate Couple (Tragedy; alteration of The Unnatural Brother, above), by Filmer; Natural Magic (Farc
ep:epHeader.ep:defectRangePerGrade: The rate of 10.74 defects per 10,000 words puts this text in the C category of texts with between 10 and 35 defects per 10,000 words.
